page.title: 04A SHEEPS YEAR IN THE DALE.
page.content: The farms in this b1ock are mainly sheep farms. In November ewes are gathered for{tupping.}In December/ January farmers{fother}them with hay to help them survive the winter. In February they are fed sheep cake to help them provide more milk for lambs. In April the farmer gathers the ewes for lambing because the moor is exposed and the farmer can check to see if they are well. When the lambs are born they are tagged and marked to show to which farmer each lamb belongs In June/July the ewes are{tailed,}the {hogs and ewes}are clipped, the tup lambs are castrated and all the sheep are dipped. The lambs are removed from their mothers who go back to the moor until tupping. Farmers keep the {gimmer (female)}lambs for breeding but sell the{wether (male)}lambs at market in the Autumn.
